## Environment
<table>
	<tr>
		<td>Product Version</td>
		<td>13.0.19.222</td>
	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>Product</td>
		<td>Progress® Telerik® Reporting</td>
	</tr>
</table>


## Description
Currently, the [PictureBox](../report-items-picture-box) can hold only the formats supported by GDI+ (BMP, GIF, JPEG, EXIF, PNG, and TIFF). This KB article demonstrates how to convert SVG graphics to PNG picture through the examples below. Note that a  third party package- Svg should be added to the with NuGet packages.  

## Solution
The first option is by using [UserFunction](../expressions-user-functions) when the report is developed from the Standalone designer. It can be implemented as the code snippet below:
```
public static Bitmap ConvertToBitmap(string url)
{
    var svgDocument = Svg.SvgDocument.Open(url);
    svgDocument.ShapeRendering = SvgShapeRendering.Auto;
 
    Bitmap bmp = svgDocument.Draw(120, 120); // Draw Bitmap in any Size you need - for example 120px x 120px
    return bmp;
}
```
Copy the generated assembly (i.e. UserFunction.dll), as well as the one for Svg to the folder that contains the Report Designer - (Telerik Reporting installation folder)\Report Designer (e.g. C:\Program Files (x86)\Progress\Telerik Reporting R1 2019\Report Designer).
Next, it will be necessary to register the copied assemblies in the Telerik.ReportDesigner.exe.config file. For the purpose you should add the following piece of code in the configuration file: 
```
<Telerik.Reporting>
   <AssemblyReferences>
     <add name="UserFunction" version="1.0.0.0" culture="neutral" publicKeyToken="null" />
     <add name="Svg" version="2.4.2.26702" culture="neutral" publicKeyToken="null" />
   </AssemblyReferences>
 </Telerik.Reporting>
```
Then the value of the picture box should be set to the following expression: 

```= UserFunction.Custom.ConvertToBitmap(Parameters.url.Value)```, where the report parameter holds the picture destination.

The second example is when the report is designed in Visual Studio. The following code snippet should be added to ItemDataBound or ItemDataBinding event of the PictureBox:
```
private void pictureBox_ItemDataBound(object sender, EventArgs e)
      {
          var svgDocument = Svg.SvgDocument.Open(@"C:\\filename.svg");  // Replace with correct destination and file name
          svgDocument.ShapeRendering = SvgShapeRendering.Auto;
          Bitmap bmp = svgDocument.Draw(120, 120);                          // Draw Bitmap in any Size you need - for example 120px x 120px
          Telerik.Reporting.Processing.PictureBox processingPictureBox = (Telerik.Reporting.Processing.PictureBox)sender;
          processingPictureBox.Image = bmp;
      }
```

The last example is when inline SVG should be converted to PNG where the MemoryStream is used for the conversion:
```
private void pictureBox_ItemDataBound(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {
            var svgString = "";
            
	    var svgImage = Convert.FromBase64String(svgString);
            Bitmap bmp;
            using (var ms = new MemoryStream(svgImage))
            {
                var svgDocument = Svg.SvgDocument.Open<SvgDocument>(ms);
 
                svgDocument.ShapeRendering = SvgShapeRendering.Auto;
                bmp = svgDocument.Draw(120, 120);                          // Draw Bitmap in any Size you need - for example 120px x 120px
            }
 
            Telerik.Reporting.Processing.PictureBox processingPictureBox = (Telerik.Reporting.Processing.PictureBox)sender;
            processingPictureBox.Image = bmp;
        }
```

## See Also
For more detailed information you may refer to the [Extending Report Designer article](../standalone-report-designer-extending-configuration).
